author: Wilhelm Arcturus

text: After the previous food discussion we had discovered that we had a bottleneck on a key ingredient for food and potions; honey. Welcome to Enshrouded But there was a solution to that… or a quest for that, from the farmer.   We could unlock the ability to make honey on a more industrial scale if we would just go kill somebody and take something from them.  A very normal fantasy world transaction.  We aren’t murder hobos, we’re in the mafia. Anyway, it was a quest to be done. Fetch the beehive smoker… and kill the person who had it… not in that order So when we got on Sunday afternoon we got ourselves provisioned, went over the goal of the expedition, and talked about a new rule for the team: Don’t shoot explosive arrows in the base. A little wood putty, a little sandpaper, it’ll look good as new That is in addition to the previous rule: Don’t test your new wand on the goats. Anyway, the plan was to go find the honey thief, do our thing, get the smoker, and see how much time we had from there.  If it went quick, the area was also marked “Passage to the Albaneve Summits” close by.  We might explore a bit of a new place. So off we went… once we figured out where to start.  The Vukah Sacrifice Hill… not to be confused with the Vukah Challenge Hill… wasn’t situated in a location that allowed for an easy glide from one of the previously discovered fast travel spires.  In the end we went to our base at the Far Away Fray Tavern, that being the nearest point from which to set out walking. I may have dumped our excess flightless birds into the courtyard at some point The walk was helped by the fact that I had trained up two new skills, one of which lets you use your grapple to pull small, flying mobs to you.  That is a boon for the melee focused as those orange desert birds fly up out of melee range and there is scant you can do about it… except now I can pull them down out of the sky to beat on them.  Satisfying. We made it up and around and across the landscape and found the area where the big guy lay waiting for us.  We cleared out the lesser mobs around the arena where the fight would take place, then went at him.  I got to use my second new skill which, for boss mobs, pulls you straight to them.  Handy for bosses with knock-back and doubly so when they don’t had good close range damage.  Ula took a bad hit during the fight, but we managed to bring him down. Your honey thieving days are over… until you respawn He dropped the beehive smoker as expected. Beehive production unlocked! We then took our usual screen shot with our targeted boss. On the corpse of the thief Oddly, his corpse wasn’t just empty space you could walk through.  It still had collision, so we could stand atop of it. That all ended pretty quickly, leaving us plenty of time to get into further trouble.  We went back out the way we came in and turned north towards the spot on the map that seemed to be where the road intersected with the legend “Passage to the Albaneve Summits” only to find a cave which, once we got a bit of a ways into it, announced our arrival in that very place. Passage to the Alaneve Summits in big letters The cave was occupied by the Vukah… though we tend to refer to them as the teddy bears… and there was some fighting and a bit of getting lost and at one point we emerged into daylight only to find we had somehow got turned around and had walked out the same place we went in. We eventually got turned in the right direction and passed into some void locations along the way. Some wide open underground shroud We wound around a side path, through another cave, across what looked like a seam between zones on the floor.  There was also some ice along the way.  Something new, something to slip and slide on. But we eventually emerged into a new setting. The view on arriving in the summits From there we could see the spire for the area.  And if you can see it, you can get there, right?  We advanced a little further down the path and came upon a small settlement. Hail fair Wickmouth We decided that it would be a good idea to setup a flame altar there.  The far side of the settlement dropped off into shroud and it wasn’t clear what the path might be to get to spire.  All we needed was five units of stone to put up an altar… and we only had three on us. Well, no problem, just dig some up. At which point we learned that Albaneve Summits is made of granite.  So all we dug up was granite, which is a form of stone… as is the limestone I found further back in the cave… but none of that would work.  You need starter zone, plain, generic stone and the game cares not for your high falutin stone with its fancy names and prefixes. I had made it all the way back to the Vukah camp before I found some stone by digging up the road bed.  Ula and Potshot, wiser than I, eventually hit on something… the tombstones to be exact… hit on them with their picks, such that they coughed up some of the needed stone. They put down the flame altar which enabled me to fast travel back to them as I had taken yet another wrong turn in the caves and emerged into another section of the zone. Together we looked at the spire and the chasm of shroud below us and wondered… how are we going to get over all of that.  But there was a bit of what I think of as a diving board… or maybe a plank to walk… pointing towards the spire and a tower visible in the middle distance.  Clearly we were meant to jump off and glide.  So we did. How hard could it be to glide there? We managed to land safely… though that was a near run thing, there being hazards about… and get to the top of the tower.  From there we had another plank pointing at another outcropping sticking up in the shroud.  We flew to that, ended up with a boss mob and a shroud root.  On defeating that… I chopped the shroud root with 18 seconds left on my shroud timer… another plank pointed into the thick shroud with nothing on the far side. Potshot and Ula trusted to it and glided off, landing safely.  I climbed around, got a bit higher, then tried to be clever, glided in the wrong direction, realized my mistake, headed for Potshot and Ula, landed in the red stuff that ran down my shroud timer to just a few seconds and, with my last possible act I double jumped, glided, and died, dropping my corpse onto some land so I could be revived. From there we followed a long, winding road that led up the mountain… and only got turned around and ran in a circle once… finding along the way some obsidian and some coal, both new materials to us which unlocked some new recipes.  We came up out of the shroud and seemed to be getting closer to the spire. The spire seems within reach now We ran along, then had to cross a broken bridge that required some accurate jumping, during which Ula accidentally double jumped, then glided and ended up on an outcropping way down a cliff.  She managed to glide and use the uplift skill to work her way back to a point where a grapple was available, at which point she was able to rejoin us.  And at that point, the spire was before us. At the spire at last As with past spires, this one had its share of puzzles to solve, though only two levels of puzzles… though the second one was a doozy and took us a while to figure out. We made it to the top and unlocked the spire as a fast travel point, having taken this route from our flame shrine to the spire. Sort of estimated… the green arrow was my bad choice From the spire top we stepped out to a balcony to see the view and immediately got hit with the cold penalty that hits you above a given altitude.  Like Valheim, you need some special gear to get by up there… and like Valheim, until you can craft the armor you have something like a potion, unlocked for us with the discovery of coal. The pocket heater recipe The armor is going to require the taming of yaks and fuzzy goats, both residents of the zone, so we can harvest wool and make the pieces. Around back of the spire we spotted a door.  Only being able to lay out two puzzle levels for us in the spire, they added one behind, which we went in and looted… though not without cost. Potshot down, having been rolled over I think that sealed it, we all died at least once on the journey. After that it was back to base to check out the newly unlocked recipes and to set up a beehive to start producing honey. Next on our list I guess is to tame some more domestic animals.  But first I need to patch up that hole in the barn.  I hope we have that type of block available. [This all took place before the big patch last week.  Some accounting for that will be forthcoming.]
html:
After the previous food discussion we had discovered that we had a bottleneck on a key ingredient for food and potions; honey.

Welcome to Enshrouded

But there was a solution to that… or a quest for that, from the farmer.   We could unlock the ability to make honey on a more industrial scale if we would just go kill somebody and take something from them.  A very normal fantasy world transaction.  We aren’t murder hobos, we’re in the mafia.

Anyway, it was a quest to be done.

Fetch the beehive smoker… and kill the person who had it… not in that order

So when we got on Sunday afternoon we got ourselves provisioned, went over the goal of the expedition, and talked about a new rule for the team: Don’t shoot explosive arrows in the base.

A little wood putty, a little sandpaper, it’ll look good as new

That is in addition to the previous rule: Don’t test your new wand on the goats.

Anyway, the plan was to go find the honey thief, do our thing, get the smoker, and see how much time we had from there.  If it went quick, the area was also marked “Passage to the Albaneve Summits” close by.  We might explore a bit of a new place.

So off we went… once we figured out where to start.  The Vukah Sacrifice Hill… not to be confused with the Vukah Challenge Hill… wasn’t situated in a location that allowed for an easy glide from one of the previously discovered fast travel spires.  In the end we went to our base at the Far Away Fray Tavern, that being the nearest point from which to set out walking.

I may have dumped our excess flightless birds into the courtyard at some point

The walk was helped by the fact that I had trained up two new skills, one of which lets you use your grapple to pull small, flying mobs to you.  That is a boon for the melee focused as those orange desert birds fly up out of melee range and there is scant you can do about it… except now I can pull them down out of the sky to beat on them.  Satisfying.

We made it up and around and across the landscape and found the area where the big guy lay waiting for us.  We cleared out the lesser mobs around the arena where the fight would take place, then went at him.  I got to use my second new skill which, for boss mobs, pulls you straight to them.  Handy for bosses with knock-back and doubly so when they don’t had good close range damage.  Ula took a bad hit during the fight, but we managed to bring him down.

Your honey thieving days are over… until you respawn

He dropped the beehive smoker as expected.

Beehive production unlocked!

We then took our usual screen shot with our targeted boss.

On the corpse of the thief

Oddly, his corpse wasn’t just empty space you could walk through.  It still had collision, so we could stand atop of it.

That all ended pretty quickly, leaving us plenty of time to get into further trouble.  We went back out the way we came in and turned north towards the spot on the map that seemed to be where the road intersected with the legend “Passage to the Albaneve Summits” only to find a cave which, once we got a bit of a ways into it, announced our arrival in that very place.

Passage to the Alaneve Summits in big letters

The cave was occupied by the Vukah… though we tend to refer to them as the teddy bears… and there was some fighting and a bit of getting lost and at one point we emerged into daylight only to find we had somehow got turned around and had walked out the same place we went in.

We eventually got turned in the right direction and passed into some void locations along the way.

Some wide open underground shroud

We wound around a side path, through another cave, across what looked like a seam between zones on the floor.  There was also some ice along the way.  Something new, something to slip and slide on. But we eventually emerged into a new setting.

The view on arriving in the summits

From there we could see the spire for the area.  And if you can see it, you can get there, right?  We advanced a little further down the path and came upon a small settlement.

Hail fair Wickmouth

We decided that it would be a good idea to setup a flame altar there.  The far side of the settlement dropped off into shroud and it wasn’t clear what the path might be to get to spire.  All we needed was five units of stone to put up an altar… and we only had three on us.

Well, no problem, just dig some up.

At which point we learned that Albaneve Summits is made of granite.  So all we dug up was granite, which is a form of stone… as is the limestone I found further back in the cave… but none of that would work.  You need starter zone, plain, generic stone and the game cares not for your high falutin stone with its fancy names and prefixes.

I had made it all the way back to the Vukah camp before I found some stone by digging up the road bed.  Ula and Potshot, wiser than I, eventually hit on something… the tombstones to be exact… hit on them with their picks, such that they coughed up some of the needed stone.

They put down the flame altar which enabled me to fast travel back to them as I had taken yet another wrong turn in the caves and emerged into another section of the zone.

Together we looked at the spire and the chasm of shroud below us and wondered… how are we going to get over all of that.  But there was a bit of what I think of as a diving board… or maybe a plank to walk… pointing towards the spire and a tower visible in the middle distance.  Clearly we were meant to jump off and glide.  So we did.

How hard could it be to glide there?

We managed to land safely… though that was a near run thing, there being hazards about… and get to the top of the tower.  From there we had another plank pointing at another outcropping sticking up in the shroud.  We flew to that, ended up with a boss mob and a shroud root.  On defeating that… I chopped the shroud root with 18 seconds left on my shroud timer… another plank pointed into the thick shroud with nothing on the far side.

Potshot and Ula trusted to it and glided off, landing safely.  I climbed around, got a bit higher, then tried to be clever, glided in the wrong direction, realized my mistake, headed for Potshot and Ula, landed in the red stuff that ran down my shroud timer to just a few seconds and, with my last possible act I double jumped, glided, and died, dropping my corpse onto some land so I could be revived.

From there we followed a long, winding road that led up the mountain… and only got turned around and ran in a circle once… finding along the way some obsidian and some coal, both new materials to us which unlocked some new recipes.  We came up out of the shroud and seemed to be getting closer to the spire.

The spire seems within reach now

We ran along, then had to cross a broken bridge that required some accurate jumping, during which Ula accidentally double jumped, then glided and ended up on an outcropping way down a cliff.  She managed to glide and use the uplift skill to work her way back to a point where a grapple was available, at which point she was able to rejoin us.  And at that point, the spire was before us.

At the spire at last

As with past spires, this one had its share of puzzles to solve, though only two levels of puzzles… though the second one was a doozy and took us a while to figure out.

We made it to the top and unlocked the spire as a fast travel point, having taken this route from our flame shrine to the spire.

Sort of estimated… the green arrow was my bad choice

From the spire top we stepped out to a balcony to see the view and immediately got hit with the cold penalty that hits you above a given altitude.  Like Valheim, you need some special gear to get by up there… and like Valheim, until you can craft the armor you have something like a potion, unlocked for us with the discovery of coal.

The pocket heater recipe

The armor is going to require the taming of yaks and fuzzy goats, both residents of the zone, so we can harvest wool and make the pieces.

Around back of the spire we spotted a door.  Only being able to lay out two puzzle levels for us in the spire, they added one behind, which we went in and looted… though not without cost.

Potshot down, having been rolled over

I think that sealed it, we all died at least once on the journey.

After that it was back to base to check out the newly unlocked recipes and to set up a beehive to start producing honey.

Next on our list I guess is to tame some more domestic animals.  But first I need to patch up that hole in the barn.  I hope we have that type of block available.

[This all took place before the big patch last week.  Some accounting for that will be forthcoming.]
